2dbda2eb-dc71-4e97-9478-8c563bc11480.description: The earner of this digital credential can apply project management skills and knowledge in a wide variety of contexts. The earner can work in projects autonomously, they may be members of a project team with no direct responsibility for overall project outcomes. The earner has demonstrated the skills to support wider project operations. They have shown that they can use project tools and methodologies selectively to support organisational or business activities.
2dbda2eb-dc71-4e97-9478-8c563bc11480.name: BSB41515 Certificate IV in Project Management Practice

alignments.name: BSB40920 - Certificate IV in Project Management Practice
alignments.description: AQF Level 4 - Certificate IV qualify individuals who apply a broad range of specialised knowledge and skills in varied contexts to undertake skilled work and as a pathway for further learning. Certificate IV qualifications enable graduates to demonstrate the learning outcomes expressed as knowledge, skills and the application of knowledge & skills.

badge_template_activities.title: Apply project scope management techniques
Apply project time management techniques
Apply project quality management techniques
Apply project cost management techniques
Apply project human resources management approaches
Apply project information management and communications techniques
Apply project risk management techniques
Apply project procurement procedures
Apply project life cycle management processes

Action Learning is a problem-solving process, in which the learning is centred on finding a solution to a recurring problem. In this instance the individual’s development is as important as finding the solution to the problem. Like any project, participants work on an important organisational issue. Time is set aside at each meeting for discussing and developing leadership skills. Success is measured by the team's ability to meet an organisational need and develop the members of the team.

07dbc7e7-6044-40cd-8944-040aff1d9e2d.description: Includes fundamental tools & concepts of project management. With a sound basis in international best practice: PME starts with the classic 5 phases of a project & drills down to discrete skills and techniques required to participate in a project e.g. task relationships. Students completing this course will be able to:  Define what a project is  Describe the relationship between scope, time & cost in projects  Describe the 5 processes of project management  Undertake key planning activities
07dbc7e7-6044-40cd-8944-040aff1d9e2d.name: CPD Project Management Essentials

alignments.name: Continuing Professional Development
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: Attendance at all three stages of the blended learning: (1) pre-work online learning; (2) live session skills development activities; (3) post-work via online learning.

Completion of: (1) Pre-Work Check Your Knowledge activities and submission of short answer questions (2) participation in live session team skills development activities (3) Post-Work assessment submission.

skills.name: Can Describe The Roles And Responsibilities Of The Project Team Members

4ca93470-6a9e-4e38-a995-39fcfde959c7.description: The Steps simulated work placement programme has been developed by Financial Counselling Australia (FCA), the national peak body for the financial counselling sector. Steps incorporates simulations & scenarios that capture the full range of contexts & situations required by the CHC51115 Diploma of Financial Counselling, allowing candidates to complete their 220 hrs of work placement in a simulated environment. Highly experienced mentors support students to develop critical work placement skills.
4ca93470-6a9e-4e38-a995-39fcfde959c7.name: STEPS Work Placement Completed

alignments.name: CHCFIN001 Facilitate the financial counselling process
alignments.description: Describes the skills & knowledge required to assess & respond to the immediate and ongoing needs of clients using a structured strengths-based & client-focused financial counselling process. Applies to financial counsellors who work in agencies that meet the requirements for the ASIC exemption from a financial services or credit licence.

alignments.name: CHCFIN002 Identify and apply technical information to assist clients with financial issues
alignments.description: Describes the skills & knowledge required to analyse & use technical information to assist individuals to understand their rights & make informed decisions about financial issues in the context of a strengths-based & client-focused financial counselling model.

alignments.name: CHCFIN003 - Develop and use financial counselling tools and techniques
alignments.description: This unit describes the skills and knowledge required to take a structured approach to the development of written tools and resources that support financial counselling. This unit applies to financial counsellors who work in agencies that meet the requirements for the ASIC exemption from a financial services or credit licence.

badge_template_activities.title: The candidate has shown evidence of the ability to complete & manage tasks & manage contingencies in the context of the job role outlined in elements & performance criteria of the financial cluster units of the CHC51115 Diploma of Financial Counselling.

The candidate has performed the activities outlined in the performance criteria of the financial cluster units during a period of 220 hours of work in a the STEPS simulated financial counselling agency.

Used critical thinking and problem solving skills to engage with the client and develop, implement and review options and action plans for at least 5 different clients presenting with multiple and complex needs.’

Used critical thinking and problem-solving to analyse financial information for at least 5 different clients with varied financial situations and developed technical solutions and options relating to: - correct income sources and entitlements - living expenses and associated support - legal and consumer protection rights - debt and debt recovery processes and options - additional advocacy options.
Developed financial resources for at least 5 different clients including: - statement of financial position - documented case/action plan.

Researched and developed all of the following financial resources: - income and expenditure statements - assets and liabilities statements - advocacy resources. • advocated for clients via each of the following mediums: - telephone - in writing: ▪ letters, and ▪ complaints to Internal Dispute Resolution (IDR)/External Dispute Resolution (EDR) o face-to-face.

bb206097-02a8-4e9c-84b7-665deff1b6d0.description: PFR encompasses key aspects that will assist you in delivering a top-quality presentation. This includes knowing your audience, setting the environment, developing the content, utilising various tools and strengthening your verbal and nonverbal language. You will be guided in the processes of planning, structuring, creating, controlling, fine-tuning and delivering – which will help you develop and master the skill of presentation.
bb206097-02a8-4e9c-84b7-665deff1b6d0.name: CPD Presenting for Results

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Identify & demonstrate the qualities of an effective presenter; Analyse & relate to your target audience; Tailor your presentations to the requirements of the intended target audience; Understand the impact which environment has on the success of your presentations; Better control the presentation environment; Scope your topic accurately and efficiently; Structure your presentation logically & succinctly; and Incorporate presentation tools, which enhance your message.

skills.name: Ability To Develop A Professional Presentation

d3febe1a-0139-4378-829f-09f531378fa4.description: The RME course introduces and builds skills with all of the major phases of the Risk Management methodology. We begin with risk identification, move on to risk analysis in terms of probability and impact, and then identify relevant risk responses. We also work with planning tools to capture and prioritise risk responses, and to devise the Risk Management strategy and plan.
d3febe1a-0139-4378-829f-09f531378fa4.name: CPD Risk Management Essentials

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.

The student has completed the in-class and online assessments for this short course programme. Completion of: (1) Pre-Work Check Your Knowledge activities and submission of short answer questions (2) participation in live session team skills development activities (3) Post-Work assessment submission.

Learning Outcomes: Apply risk identification strategies & processes; Discuss the distinctions between ‘positive’ and ‘negative’ risk; Differentiate between the two risk analysis dimensions of probability and impact; Define classic and specific risk-response approaches; Suggest appropriate responses to specific risks; Develop a Risk Management strategy & plan (with a special focus on Project Management applications); and Appreciate the human, political and cultural dimensions of Risk Management.

6efb66da-f4f6-450c-abde-be0f4b62d58f.description: Supplier Relationship Management provides a comprehensive guide to establishing strong & healthy relationships with suppliers, leveraging these relationships for mutual advantage & controlling potential areas for conflict or damage. Working through the entire relationship cycle, gaining experience with practical tools to manage the relationship, the course develops the communication & interpersonal skills necessary to develop beneficial supplier relationships on behalf of the organisation.
6efb66da-f4f6-450c-abde-be0f4b62d58f.name: CPD Supplier Relationship Management

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.

The student has completed the in-class and online assessments for this short course programme. Completion of: (1) Pre-Work Check Your Knowledge activities and submission of short answer questions (2) participation in live session team skills development activities (3) Post-Work assessment submission.

Learning Outcomes: Describe and plan for all of the stages of the supplier relationship cycle; Recognise and avoid potential pitfalls with supplier relationships; Leverage successful supplier relationships for mutual advantage; Explain how interactions with suppliers may have wider-ranging impacts for your organisation’s interests; Promote a positive image for your organisation in all your dealings; and Help your organisation to achieve ‘preferred client’ status within your market.

da26a510-2523-4c67-a081-20f46ce11d50.description: CLO helps participants understand the nature & sources of organisational change, proactively engage with change drivers, and promote success with change initiatives. CLO encourages participants to recognise the relationship of their organisation to the external environment, develop their analytical & communication skills, & plan for their organisation’s continuous development. We focus on tools & frameworks which enable the organisation to keep pace with (or surpass) rapid environmental change.
da26a510-2523-4c67-a081-20f46ce11d50.name: CPD Change & The Learning Organisation

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.

The student has completed the in-class and online assessments for this short course programme. Completion of: (1) Pre-Work Check Your Knowledge activities and submission of short answer questions (2) participation in live session team skills development activities (3) Post-Work assessment submission.

Learning Outcomes: Describe & distinguish classic types of organisational change; Identify & analyse a wide range of change drivers from the external environment; Explain classic models for identifying and managing change; Avoid typical failure-paths; Effectively formulate & communicate a vision for change; Establish a sense of urgency; Promote change; Understand how to anchor the change within organisational culture; Help develop own learning organisation.

skills.name: Adaptive Leadership; Team Building; Change Management

9d50e353-01d4-4c34-a9ff-184f90b51aa0.description: DWE begins with an examination of the development cycle, focussing on how to scope the need in greater detail, researching to match your scope, structuring to suit content, & managing review & sign-off processes efficiently. DWE explains & develops skills with a number of key topics in grammar & expression. The courses examines short reports, email & presentations. Presented with ongoing opportunities to integrate your knowledge & develop your skills through practical writing activities.
9d50e353-01d4-4c34-a9ff-184f90b51aa0.name: CPD Document Writing Essentials (1 day)

badge_template_activities.title: Approach each writing project confidently
Use an ordered and streamlined development cycle to complete each writing project to deadline
Define and fix a document’s scope at the beginning of the process
Manage stakeholder involvement and contributions more effectively through the development cycle
Control the quality of documents more directly, in terms of grammar and expression
Understand the conventions and forms of short reports, email and presentations
One day course attendance and completion of context-specific skills development activities.
Completion of context-specific skills development activities throughout the course, plus the completion of a Consolidation Activity writing task.
CPD Points Awarded :8 points

891daf83-0c98-4764-a5e5-a18048e7824f.description: The HPT course begins by examining all of the steps to develop a high performance team, from initial formation, to goal setting, through to designing roles. From this point on, we consider team functions, interactions and relationships with a primary interest in achieving exceptional results. Most particularly, we consider how you can have an effective role in driving those results.
891daf83-0c98-4764-a5e5-a18048e7824f.name: CPD High Performance Teams

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

The student has completed the in-class and online assessments for this short course programme. Completion of: (1) Pre-Work Check Your Knowledge activities and submission of short answer questions (2) participation in live session team skills development activities (3) Post-Work assessment submission.

Learning Outcomes: Contribute to the creation of a team performance plan; Develop, facilitate and actively promote team cohesion; Delegate tasks and responsibilities amongst team members; Facilitate team work; and Liaise effectively with management and other internal and external stakeholders.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team Environment
Adaptive Leadership; Team Building; Change Management

eedec2d7-7391-4569-85b3-fa4905e533f3.description: This qualification reflects the role of individuals who apply project management skills and knowledge. They may manage projects in a variety of contexts, across a number of industry sectors. They have project leadership and management roles and are responsible for achieving project objectives. They possess a sound theoretical knowledge base and use a range of specialised, technical and managerial competencies to initiate, plan, execute and evaluate their own work and/or the work of others.
eedec2d7-7391-4569-85b3-fa4905e533f3.name: BSB51415 Diploma of Project Management

alignments.name: BSB51415 - Diploma of Project Management (Release 4)
alignments.description: AQF Level 5 Diploma - graduates demonstrate strong technical & theoretical knowledge in Project Management. Diploma Graduates apply knowledge & skills to demonstrate autonomy, judgement & defined responsibility in known or changing project management contexts & within broad but established parameters.

badge_template_activities.title: Manage project scope
Manage project time
Manage project quality
Manage project cost
Manage project human resources
Manage project information management and communication
Manage project risk
Manage project procurement
Manage personal work priorities and professional development
Lead and manage team effectiveness
Build and sustain an innovative environment
Manage project integration

Action Learning is a problem-solving process, in which the learning is centred on finding a solution to a recurring problem. In this instance the individual’s development is as important as finding the solution to the problem. Like any project, participants work on an important organisational issue. Time is set aside at each meeting for discussing and developing leadership skills. Success is measured by the team's ability to meet an organisational need and develop the members of the team.

31e53d98-cc0b-4a22-8d21-a494c3be2901.description: Effective workplace writing skills are a key competency for any professional. The course (1) focuses directly on advancing formal writing skills & maximising efficiency in producing documents; (2) begins with a review of the writing process; (3) explains & builds skills with further topics in grammar, typography & expression; (4) examines long reports and specifications, and (5) examines uses for writing in a range of document types, using the concepts of 'registers of language'.
31e53d98-cc0b-4a22-8d21-a494c3be2901.name: Advanced Document Writing (2 days)

badge_template_activities.title: Negotiate the scoping process more effectively, through greater understanding of scoping elements and stakeholders
Conduct a detailed task analysis
Understand the functional selection of document type
Evaluate grammatical precision in their writing
Make use of typographical techniques to improve accessibility of their documents
Employ more effective expression
Work effectively with long reports, specifications and registers of language
Two day course attendance and completion of context-specific skills development activities.
Completion of context-specific skills development activities throughout the course, plus the completion of a Consolidation Activity writing task.
CPD Points Awarded : 14 points

skills.name: Planning And Structuring A Business Report

9d873a11-13a3-42ad-848b-1939ad86abec.description: ENS focuses on negotiating in a professional context, though the principles covered are applicable to all aspects of a person’s life. We consider all phases of a negotiation & a range of negotiating partners both internal & external. ENS will give you a comprehensive picture of the science & the art of negotiating. We will begin by examining the formal structures and conventions of negotiations. ENS develops the skills necessary to maximise your outcomes in a range of negotiation settings.
9d873a11-13a3-42ad-848b-1939ad86abec.name: CPD Essential Negotiation Skills

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Define the term ‘negotiation’; Describe the negotiation process; Prepare for negotiation events; Complete a Key Interest Matrix for a negotiation event; Apply the negotiation process to your negotiation event; Employ negotiation tactics to obtain your desired outcomes; Conduct follow up and review activities, to continuously improve your negotiation skills.

9f444fe9-08ec-459e-8060-024149976d20.description: A@W has been designed to help participants understand the different modes of interaction which exist, and the benefits of assertiveness. Assertiveness at Work encourages participants to adopt an assertive outlook on their contexts, and provides many opportunities to develop their assertiveness skills through role-plays and scenario-based activities. As we work through this course, we will focus particularly on the advantages of using assertive communication techniques within the workplace.
9f444fe9-08ec-459e-8060-024149976d20.name: CPD Assertiveness @ Work

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Describe and distinguish the four classic modes of interaction; Explain the beneficial uses (and the misuses) of the modes;  Understand their preferred mode; Recognise the particular benefits of assertiveness; Explain how an individual’s outlook will influence their ability to engage assertively; and Structure and express their assertiveness for maximum effect.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

ea1c1896-c28f-4e87-8b96-6250142a6839.description: This course begins by defining teams, and exploring their unique potential capabilities. We then consider how to make them as cohesive and productive as possible. Throughout, we engage with a number of classic team challenges and functions, including managing conflict, delegation and decision-making. BETP will help you to develop the communication and interpersonal skills necessary to contribute effectively to your team, and to influence positive outcomes.
ea1c1896-c28f-4e87-8b96-6250142a6839.name: CPD Being an Effective Team Player

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Differentiate between ‘groups’ and ‘teams’; Recognise the unique properties and benefits of the team structure; Explain that characteristics which enhance team cohesion & performance; Recognise and respond appropriately to the contexts of problem solving and decision making, delegation, performance monitoring and conflict; Promote open communication and networking within their teams; Contribute productively and comfortably to their team; and Influence positive outcomes.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

7d36f93b-050d-48bc-8e85-646df6715b18.description: This course covers all of the overarching concepts involved with Creative Problem Solving, & presents an end-to-end methodology for addressing problem scenarios. CPS pays attention both to the logical & practical aspects on one side, & the political & communication-related aspects of rolling out solutions on the other. Problem solving concepts & techniques may be applied to improving systems & work practices; & used to identify & capitalise on opportunities that others do not perceive.
7d36f93b-050d-48bc-8e85-646df6715b18.name: CPD Creative Problem Solving

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Discuss current perspectives on problem solving; List and describe the five approaches to solving problems; Use the SORT™ methodology to solve problems creatively; Employ best-practice tools to work through the creative problem solving process; and Apply best-practice methodology to workplace problems.

fa420850-5ee1-4d2b-b734-c2cfc1e95a00.description: TWE begins with an examination of the development cycle, focussing on how to scope the need in greater detail, researching to match your scope, structuring to suit content, & managing review & sign-off processes efficiently. aa3974e1-f603-4a22-8ba5-6832f1aa43d1.description: TW&Y introduces the principles & techniques of time management, including identifying your work patterns, & evaluating and prioritising goals into long- and short-term plans. You learn how to utilise various resources to manage your time and jobs effectively and efficiently. You are supported through various activities that have been specifically designed and tailored to develop essential skills and knowledge in the areas of prioritising, goal-setting, delegation and stress reduction.
aa3974e1-f603-4a22-8ba5-6832f1aa43d1.name: CPD Time Work and You

badge_template_activities.title: Explain the principles of time management
Perform a time audit
Identify personal productivity cycles
List common workplace time wasters
Create a goal-setting plan
Prioritise tasks according to sound time management principles
Set long and short term plans
Describe common personality types, and their impacts on time management
Maintain the quality of their output by managing the scale of their workload
One day course attendance and completion of context-specific skills development activities.
Completion of context-specific skills development activities throughout the course, plus the completion of a Consolidation Activity writing task.
CPD Points Awarded: 8 points

skills.name: Coaching; Work Life Balance; Time Management; Tackling Procrastination; Boundaries; Goal Setting; Active Listening; Empathy; Powerful Questioning
Maximize Your Productivity by Managing Time and Tasks
Task Prioritization And Time Management Skills

a2e126c1-c1d2-4b74-8269-fb5ef07c2318.description: CSE discusses differences & similarities between internal & external customers. It examines how service delivery adapts flexibly to different commercial contexts & relationships. CSE builds a model for excellent service delivery, considers how to overcome barriers to great service, & notes the significant benefits from making an investment in customer service. CSE concludes by describing the requirements for a service culture within your organisation.
a2e126c1-c1d2-4b74-8269-fb5ef07c2318.name: CPD Customer Service Essentials

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme. Throughout the course, service contexts (such as complaint-handling) are addressed in skills development, via scenario-based activities.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Define internal & external customers, & describe appropriate attitudes to both; Explain the adaptability of customer service and its broad traditions, in terms of ‘customers’, ‘clients’, ‘products’ and ‘services’; Recognise & apply a best-practice model for excellent service delivery; Confront & overcome barriers to service delivery; Describe the commercial benefits of customer service; & Understand how to contribute to a customer service culture within their own organisation.

skills.name: Ability To Work In A Team

592daddd-1151-4bb0-83b7-38158ad39858.description: This course examines leadership attributes of all kinds, and where they may be found and harnessed. After first distinguishing between the functions of leadership and management, we will move on to recognising several styles of leadership – and how and where they may be best applied.
592daddd-1151-4bb0-83b7-38158ad39858.name: CPD Future Leaders

alignments.name: Continued Professional Development Points
alignments.description: CPD points awarded for this short course = 8. The calculation applied is a 1:1 ratio and based on active course participation as well as the completion of assessments.

badge_template_activities.title: The student has attended the training required for this short course programme.
The student has completed the in-class and / or online assessments for this short course programme.

Learning Outcomes: Differentiate between ‘managing’ & ‘leading’; Understand the role of leadership in the context of the organisation’s vision, mission & strategy; Recognise own leadership potential & attributes; Describe a variety of leadership styles & the appropriate contexts; Avoid the pitfalls inherent on inappropriate use or over-reliance on a given style; Formulate a plan to further develop their own leadership qualities; Understand how own leadership contribution may be of benefit.

c986a853-ee6e-4674-bec7-a53b7943312c.description: Combining three of TechKnowledgey's best selling courses - Assertiveness @ Work, Presenting for Results and Document Wrtiting Essentials - this course has been designed to help participants understand their default communication modes and encourages them to adopt an assertive outlook on their contexts, and provides many opportunities to develop their assertive professional communication skills (verbal and written) through role-plays and scenario-based activities.

skills.name: Ability To Build And Develop Professional Relationships

06439b02-a161-4d2a-ae76-14ddf935813c.description: REM covers the essentials involved with running effective meetings, from creating practical agendas, to coordinating the event, to producing & leveraging the desired results. We consider best practice approaches, relate these to your specific context and stakeholders, & develop your skills with targeted activities. REM delivers a comprehensive focus on the organisational, communication-based & interpersonal skills necessary to produce outstanding returns from the meetings you run.
06439b02-a161-4d2a-ae76-14ddf935813c.name: CPD Running Effective Meetings

Learning Outcomes: Establish practical and relevant meeting outcomes; Coordinate the meeting event efficiently; Execute the agenda comprehensively; Engage participants inclusively, to gather broad-based input; Maximise the problem-solving and decision-making potential of meetings; Manage challenging behaviours; Maintain momentum and interest; Capture meeting outcomes; and Drive constructive results, following the event.

CPD Points Awarded : 21 points

skills.name: Audience and Purpose in Business Writing

51ae0cc6-29cb-4e17-ad02-beddf1c1e240.description: DWE begins with an examination of the development cycle, focussing on how to scope the need in greater detail, researching to match your scope, structuring to suit content, & managing review & sign-off processes efficiently. DWE explains & develops skills with a number of key topics in grammar & expression. The courses examines short reports, email & presentations. Presented with ongoing opportunities to integrate your knowledge & develop your skills through practical writing activities.
51ae0cc6-29cb-4e17-ad02-beddf1c1e240.name: Document Writing Essentials (2 days)

badge_template_activities.title: Approach each writing project confidently
Use an ordered and streamlined development cycle to complete each writing project to deadline
Define and fix a document’s scope at the beginning of the process
Manage stakeholder involvement and contributions more effectively through the development cycle
Control the quality of documents more directly, in terms of grammar and expression
Understand the conventions and forms of short reports, email and presentations
Two day course attendance and completion of context-specific skills development activities.
Completion of context-specific skills development activities throughout the course, plus the completion of a Consolidation Activity writing task.
CPD Points Awarded : 14 points

b195f844-28a6-40e1-9c02-cebd1d015883.description: The earner of this digital credential can apply project management skills and knowledge in a wide variety of contexts. The earner can work in projects autonomously, they may be members of a project team with no direct responsibility for overall project outcomes. The earner has demonstrated the skills to support wider project operations. They have shown that they can use project tools and methodologies selectively to support organisational or business activities.
b195f844-28a6-40e1-9c02-cebd1d015883.name: BSB40920 Certificate IV in Project Management Practice

alignments.name: BSB40920 - Certificate IV in Project Management Practice
alignments.description: AQF Level 4 - Certificate IV qualify individuals who apply a broad range of specialised knowledge and skills in varied contexts to undertake skilled work and as a pathway for further learning. Certificate IV qualifications enable graduates to demonstrate the learning outcomes expressed as knowledge, skills and the application of knowledge & skills.

badge_template_activities.title: BSBPMG420 Apply project scope management techniques
BSBPMG421 Apply project time management techniques
BSBPMG422 Apply project quality management techniques
BSBPMG423 Apply project cost management techniques
BSBPMG424 Apply project human resources management approaches
BSBPMG425 Apply project information management and communications techniques
BSBPMG426 Apply project risk management techniques
BSBPMG427 Apply project procurement procedures
BSBPMG428 Apply project life cycle management processes

Action Learning is a problem-solving process, in which the learning is centred on finding a solution to a recurring problem. In this instance the individual’s development is as important as finding the solution to the problem. Like any project, participants work on an important organisational issue. Time is set aside at each meeting for discussing and developing leadership skills. Success is measured by the team's ability to meet an organisational need and develop the members of the team.

349e7ebf-40c7-49fe-b19d-c889b9502a65.description: This qualification reflects the role of individuals who apply project management skills and knowledge. They may manage projects in a variety of contexts, across a number of industry sectors. They have project leadership and management roles and are responsible for achieving project objectives. They possess a sound theoretical knowledge base and use a range of specialised, technical and managerial competencies to initiate, plan, execute and evaluate their own work and/or the work of others.
349e7ebf-40c7-49fe-b19d-c889b9502a65.name: BSB50820 Diploma of Project Management

alignments.name: BSB51415 - Diploma of Project Management (Release 4)
alignments.description: AQF Level 5 Diploma - graduates demonstrate strong technical & theoretical knowledge in Project Management. Diploma Graduates apply knowledge & skills to demonstrate autonomy, judgement & defined responsibility in known or changing project management contexts & within broad but established parameters.

BSBPMG540 Manage project integration
